description.para: Calls the AWS Backup Gateway GetVirtualMachine API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2022 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: By providing the ARN (Amazon Resource Name), this API returns the virtual machine.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual machine.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'VirtualMachine'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.BackupGateway.Model.GetVirtualMachineResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.BackupGateway.Model.GetVirtualMachineResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

This cmdlet returns an Amazon.BackupGateway.Model.VirtualMachineDetails object. The service call response (type Amazon.BackupGateway.Model.GetVirtualMachineResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
Calls the AWS Backup Gateway AssociateGatewayToServer API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2022 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: Associates a backup gateway with your server. After you complete the association process, you can back up and restore your VMs through the gateway.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the ListGateways operation to return a list of gateways for your account and Amazon Web Services Region.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the server that hosts your virtual machines.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'GatewayArn'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.BackupGateway.Model.AssociateGatewayToServerResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.BackupGateway.Model.AssociateGatewayToServerResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the GatewayArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^GatewayArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

description.para: Tests your hypervisor configuration to validate that backup gateway can connect with the hypervisor and its resources.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway to the hypervisor to test.
The server host of the hypervisor. This can be either an IP address or a fully-qualified domain name (FQDN).

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.BackupGateway.Model.TestHypervisorConfigurationResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

description.para: Creates a backup gateway. After you create a gateway, you can associate it with a server using the AssociateGatewayToServer operation.
The activation key of the created gateway.
The display name of the created gateway.
A list of up to 50 tags to assign to the gateway. Each tag is a key-value pair.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'GatewayArn'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.BackupGateway.Model.CreateGatewayResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.BackupGateway.Model.CreateGatewayResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The activation key of the created gateway.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The display name of the created gateway.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'GatewayArn'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.BackupGateway.Model.CreateGatewayResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.BackupGateway.Model.CreateGatewayResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
A list of up to 50 tags to assign to the gateway. Each tag is a key-value pair.

This cmdlet returns a System.String object. The service call response (type Amazon.BackupGateway.Model.CreateGatewayResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
Calls the AWS Backup Gateway UpdateHypervisor API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2022 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: Updates a hypervisor metadata, including its host, username, and password. Specify which hypervisor to update using the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the hypervisor in your request.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the hypervisor to update.
The updated host of the hypervisor. This can be either an IP address or a fully-qualified domain name (FQDN).
The updated name for the hypervisor
The updated password for the hypervisor.
The updated username for the hypervisor.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'HypervisorArn'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.BackupGateway.Model.UpdateHypervisorResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.BackupGateway.Model.UpdateHypervisorResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the HypervisorArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^HypervisorArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the hypervisor to update.
The updated host of the hypervisor. This can be either an IP address or a fully-qualified domain name (FQDN).
The updated name for the hypervisor

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the HypervisorArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^HypervisorArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
The updated password for the hypervisor.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'HypervisorArn'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.BackupGateway.Model.UpdateHypervisorResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.BackupGateway.Model.UpdateHypervisorResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
The updated username for the hypervisor.

This cmdlet returns a System.String object. The service call response (type Amazon.BackupGateway.Model.UpdateHypervisorResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
Calls the AWS Backup Gateway PutMaintenanceStartTime API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2022 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: Set the maintenance start time for a gateway.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the gateway, used to specify its maintenance start time.
The day of the month start maintenance on a gateway. Valid values range from Sunday to Saturday.
The day of the week to start maintenance on a gateway.
The hour of the day to start maintenance on a gateway.
The minute of the hour to start maintenance on a gateway.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'GatewayArn'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.BackupGateway.Model.PutMaintenanceStartTimeResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.BackupGateway.Model.PutMaintenanceStartTimeResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the GatewayArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^GatewayArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The day of the month start maintenance on a gateway. Valid values range from Sunday to Saturday.
The day of the week to start maintenance on a gateway.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the gateway, used to specify its maintenance start time.
The hour of the day to start maintenance on a gateway.
The minute of the hour to start maintenance on a gateway.
